articles.title: New Zealand announces plans to boost local defence sector
articles.description: The New Zealand government said on Friday it was changing defence procurement rules and introducing a new military technology fund in an effort to boost the local defence sector as government spending is set to increase.
articles.content: WELLINGTON, Oct 3 (Reuters) - The New Zealand government said on Friday it was changing defence procurement rules and introducing a new military technology fund in an effort to boost the local defence sector as government spending is set to increase.... [1697 chars]

articles.title: New Zealand's Defence Revamp: Boosting Local Industry and Innovation
articles.description: The New Zealand government is revising defence procurement rules and launching a military technology fund to enhance its local defence sector amid increased spending. This includes integrating local businesses in defence projects and establishing a fund to foster military technology innovation.
articles.content: In a strategic move to bolster its defence sector, the New Zealand government announced a revision of its defence procurement rules alongside the launch of a new military technology fund. This initiative aims to invigorate local industry as governmen... [718 chars]

articles.title: The Truth Of AI In HR: A Wake-Up Call For The People Function
articles.description: HR leaders and their teams need to understand that, rather than serving as a replacement, AI technology can elevate their function.
articles.content:
Giovanni Luperti is the CEO and co-founder of Humaans.
We’re standing at the edge of a technological shift unlike anything HR has seen before. AI is reshaping how we work, make decisions and scale. Yet the narrative is clouded by misconceptions: fear... [5758 chars]

articles.title: General Dynamics gets $1.25 billion IT contract to support US Army in Europe, Africa
articles.description: (Reuters) -Defense giant General Dynamics' information and technology unit had secured a $1.25 billion task order to support the U.S. Army in Europe and Africa, it said on Thursday, a week after announcing another $1.5 billion U.S. defense contract.
articles.content:
(Reuters) -Defense giant General Dynamics' information and technology unit had secured a $1.25 billion task order to support the U.S. Army in Europe and Africa, it said on Thursday, a week after announcing another $1.5 billion U.S. defense contract.

articles.title: Wall St marks record closing highs on tech support
articles.description: Wall Street's three major indices marked record closing highs with modest gains on Thursday, largely thanks to support from the technology sector, while investors cautiously monitored private labor market data on the second day of a US government shutdown.
articles.content: NEW YORK: Wall Street's three major indices marked record closing highs with modest gains on Thursday, largely thanks to support from the technology sector, while investors cautiously monitored private labor market data on the second day of a US gove... [3839 chars]

articles.title: Daiwa Hires AI Startup Sakana to Develop Tool for Retail Clients
articles.description: Daiwa Securities Group Inc. is hiring startup Sakana AI to develop an artificial intelligence tool that can analyze individual investor profiles, joining a growing number of financial institutions adopting the technology to boost efficiency.
articles.content:
Daiwa Securities Group Inc. is hiring startup Sakana AI to develop an artificial intelligence tool that can analyze individual investor profiles, joining a growing number of financial institutions adopting the technology to boost efficiency.

articles.title: FIFA unveil World Cup ball... and it's powered by AI! Chiefs laud 'most advanced ball ever created' with INSTANT feedback set to help VAR make faster handball and offside calls
articles.description: The Adidas Trionda - meaning 'three waves' - is out for £119/$160 and is designed to help match officials as much as players, with interior technology informing offside decisions.
articles.content:
FIFA have unveiled the official ball for the 2026 World Cup - and it's powered by AI.
The Adidas Trionda - meaning 'three waves' - is out for £119/$160 and is designed to help match officials as much as players, with interior technology informing off... [2002 chars]

articles.title: Citadel Bumps Stake in SPAC by 1,300% Days Before SEC Approved Its Merger With Nuclear Plant Developer
articles.description: Citadel Advisors purchased around a million shares of a blank cheque company just before it received SEC approval for a merger with a leading nuclear technology firm, which recently secured multiple
articles.content:
Disclaimer 2 Oct: The headline and article has been edited to clarify that Citadel, not Ken Griffin, purchased shares of HCM II Acquisition Corp.
Billionaire investor Kenneth Griffin leads one of the most successful hedge funds in the world. As the f... [3356 chars]

articles.title: Indian companies' CEO Forum discusses two-way investments in Canada
articles.description: OTTAWA, Oct 2: The Indian Consulate here organised a discussion with CEOs of Indian companies with a significant presence in Canada, underscoring avenues for two-way investments, joint ventures, and technology collaborations.   The development comes weeks after India and Canada relations witnessed a reset. On Wednesday, the Consulate organised the Indian CEOs Forum with High Commissioner Dinesh K Patnaik holding discussions with CEOs of Indian companies with a significant presence in Canada. “The dialogue underscored avenues for two-way investments, […]
articles.content:
By
Daily Excelsior
-
OTTAWA, Oct 2: The Indian Consulate here organised a discussion with CEOs of Indian companies with a significant presence in Canada, underscoring avenues for two-way investments, joint ventures, and technology collaborations.
The... [762 chars]
